title.rendered: Suntory Pure Malt Sherry Wood Yamazaki 1986

content.rendered: Suntory is the oldest whisky making company in Japan. Its origins stretch back to a small shop, started in 1899 by Torii Shinjiro, which specialized in selling imported wines. Today, it is the country’s largest and most recognizable producer of quality whisky. This particular Sherry Wood Yamazaki whisky is one of the world’s great single malts. All vintages are world class, this bottle is distilled in 1985 and bottled in 2000. Only 1200 bottles ever made.

excerpt.rendered:
Distillery: Yamazaki
Distilled: 1986
Whisky Origin: Japanese
Single Malt: Yes
Weight: 2 Kg
